subject: NRES
name: Freshman Seminar
info: In-depth study of issues/topics related to natural resources and the envirnment.  Topics vary and are announced each semester.

subject: NRES
name: Wrecked Ships/Ravaged Forests
fullname: Wrecked Ships and Ravaged Forests: Wood Use and Seafaring in Antiquity
info: Seafaring as impetus for understanding ancient cultures. Historical documents, nautical archaeology, iconography, ethnographic studies, efforts to replicate ancient ships. Ships 12,000 years ago: materials, construction. Canoes/dugouts, funerary ships of Egypt, cargo carriers of northern Europe, warships from around world. Ship types/design, what they say about cultures. Experts lead discussions in their areas of interest.

subject: NRES
name: Colloq.  NRES
fullname: Colloquium:  Natural Resources and Environmental Studies
info: Lectures from experts; readings and discussions of current environmental topics/issues.  Topics vary and are announced each semester.  Meets with NRES 5000.

subject: NRES
name: Natural History of Costa Rica
info: History/culture of Costa Rica. Geology/biogeography of Central America. Vulcanism and tropical soils. Tropical marine ecology. Survey of tropical plants, insects, birds, marine invertebrates, and local fauna. Conservation issues. Lectures, seminars, labs, field work, written project.

subject: NRES
name: Natural Resources Planning
info: Natural resource planning for multiple resource uses. Techniques/models for evaluating/assessing trade-offs among alternative management plans. Case studies, laboratory exercises.

subject: NRES
name: Advanced Water Quality
info: Problem based approach to water quality assessment, designing a monitoring/communication program. Field/lab portions: conduct, interpret, and report water quality chemical, physical, and biological variables in an on-campus stream-wetland complex.

subject: NRES
name: Water Quality
fullname: Water Quality: Management of a Natural Resource
info: Biophysical water quality in the context of today's management concerns. Active learning approaches, and global and ecological perspectives toward understanding the management of surface and groundwater resources.

subject: NRES
name: Advanced Water Quality
info: Problem based approach to water quality assessment, designing a monitoring/communication program. Field/lab portions: conduct, interpret, and report water quality chemical, physical, and biological variables in an on-campus stream-wetland complex.

subject: NRES
name: Natural Resources Planning
info: Natural resource planning for multiple resource uses. Techniques/models for evaluating/assessing trade-offs among alternative management plans. Case studies, laboratory exercises.

subject: NRES
name: Int'l Water Quality
info: How culture drives water quality management. How/why management varies among countries. Multinational river basin compacts, policies for international management. Active learning approaches.
